tracks.name: Room 3
tracks.description: ground floor,  owned by Cluj JavaScripters

tracks.name: Room 4
tracks.description: first floor, owned by Tabăra de Testare

tracks.name: Room 6
tracks.description: first floor, owned by Mozilla Romania

tracks.name: Room 9
tracks.description: first floor, owned by The BA Lounge

sessions.title: State of the nation: What will the future bring us?
The neurosciene beyond the usability
sessions.description: One of the fields that can be successfully applied to usability testing is neuroscience, which can be used in conducting long-term analyses on what a website’s usability would pose. I will explain how the human brain is implicated in each process used in usability.

sessions.title: Start Writing Modern JavaScript
sessions.description: During this session I will showcase some of the major features behind EcmaScript 2015, which is the new JavaScript standard. We will understand the impact that the new syntax has on our code and we will see how we can leverage the full power of JavaScript today to make our code better.

sessions.title: Serverless computing - How to fire your Sysadmin and run your code in a scalable and secure environment
sessions.description: The future of cloud is serverless computing. All of the major cloud providers are going all-in on this new “serverless" paradigm. Amazon Web Service’s Lambda, Google’s Cloud Functions, IBM’s OpenWhisk, and now Azure’s Functions. This session will cover the basic principles of implementing serverless architectures and zoom into Microsoft's offering in this space: Azure Functions.

sessions.title: Be more than a BA
sessions.description: Seek out ways to go above and beyond your role every day: do requirements engineering not requirements gathering, do not settle for the obvious, challenge every word, don't take everything for granted, make suggestions, provide alternatives, take decisions. Be proactive.

sessions.title: The rising of millennial testers
sessions.description:
The rising of millennial testers
1. Track
My session sits best on the following areas: software testing, motivation, learning. 
2. Session Summary
Millennials! They are here!
Even thought millennials are a big presence in almost all companies, especially in software development, only few subjects or concrete actions converge around this topic. Learning, working, decision making and leading are shaped due to their presence.
I want to share with the public initiatives that I’ve implemented within a team of millennial testers, failed and successful initiatives, mindset changes within the team and the organization (including myself) and lessons learned.

3. Session Take Away
My audience can learn from this session:
- How to promote sharing and learning in a team or organization;
- How to keep a team of millennial testers motivated;
- What I learned from my team of millennial testers;
4. Intended Audience
Even the “experiments” are mainly done with a testing team, the subject is quite general and applicable to any team profile (developers, analysts) so everybody can benefit from it at the end.
5. Previous Speaking Engagements
I presented the same topic at Tabara de Testare Bucuresti.

sessions.title: Testing Tours - Exploratory Learning
sessions.description:
To attend you need to RSVP here: http://bit.ly/2ekuXzO

Application tours are very useful in testing, but not many try them out. They definitely should be on your “to learn” list. We propose you a workshop with hands-on touring exercises. You will learn a few possible tours and try them out by yourselves. Then, we’ll do a debrief to discuss what you’ve learned, what the challenges are and how you can apply it in your projects.
You will learn how to do an application tour, which is a handy testing technique. Remember, tours are testing in learning mode, so you will be testing to learn.

sessions.title: Steps to Continuous Deployment
sessions.description:
Continuous Deployment - A cool thing that few software teams do, a lot of others admire and some hate. 
In this discussion I'd like to go over some steps that are required in order to reach daily releases and share my experience

sessions.title: How to touch you cellphone Android way
sessions.description:
Finger up, finger down, move the finger, one finger on the phone, 2 fingers, more fingers, all of them can touch the same phone. 
 Let’s make the user happy by offering an awesome interaction with his phone in our apps.
 We will discuss about The Android Touch System and it’s pitfalls, Touch Event Framework, Custom Touch Handling.
 For sure it will be a fun session for the mobile developers on Android and not only

sessions.title: We're agile, now what? - From doing scrum to scaling well
sessions.description: There is quite a difference between having rolled out scrum and having a framework that will help an organization really become agile. The presentation will cover topics such as the importance of cross-functional teams, pros & cons of feature vs component teams as well as the importance of limiting WIP to allow scrum to scale for larger organizations.

sessions.title: Web Compatibility Testing
sessions.description: Many users nowadays connect to the web directly from mobile – skipping any desktop experience. So why would you risk using them? Learn from the web-bugs we found and give a fair and beautiful experience to your users!

sessions.title: Ownership in SDLC
sessions.description:
The presentation is aimed for anyone who is passionate about processes and project management.
We will analyse a project through it’s lifecycle and discuss about ownership at each step of the way. 
More than that, we’ll go through the lessons learned and check some cool tips and tricks that can make your project an awesome one.

sessions.title: Bash on Windows
sessions.description:
We will be talking about the Linux userspace that is built into windows.

We will be looking at how it works, what it can do, what it can't do, and most importantly how it differs from other options.

sessions.title: The Elements of Influence: A Generational Assessment of Leadership and Power
sessions.description: We will dive in one of the newest surveys run by Center for Leadership Studies - The Elements of Influence: A Generational Assessment of Leadership and Power. The workshop will focus on leadership as any attempt to influence. Leadership behavior is one of the primary driving forces for productivity, engagement and retention.

sessions.title: Application Security: Why and How
sessions.description:
Showing people just how easy it is to break software on the web today. 
Mobile included.

Just wait to see it.

sessions.title: Testing Tours - Exploratory Learning  (part 2)
sessions.description:
To attend you need to RSVP here: http://bit.ly/2ekuXzO

Application tours are very useful in testing, but not many try them out. They definitely should be on your “to learn” list. We propose you a workshop with hands-on touring exercises. You will learn a few possible tours and try them out by yourselves. Then, we’ll do a debrief to discuss what you’ve learned, what the challenges are and how you can apply it in your projects.
You will learn how to do an application tour, which is a handy testing technique. Remember, tours are testing in learning mode, so you will be testing to learn.

sessions.title: Build an Intelligent Bot to Interact with your Users
sessions.description: Bots are all the rage these days. But if you need one that's capable to understand your users' natural language, so it can figure out what they WANT and not just what they say, then you're going to need some pretty strong AI behind it. Come to this session to find out how you can use Microsoft Bot Framework together with Language Understanding Intelligent Service (luis.ai)  to build an intelligent bot for Skype, Slack, Facebook, SMS and more.

sessions.title: A New Direction in Modern Web Apps
sessions.description:
Are the differences between the latest JavaScript frameworks that big? But what are the similarities between them?
There's a shift on the way JavaScript applications are built towards unidirectional data flow, component based architecture and maybe functional programming. 
Let's explore the common path they take, the concepts behind and what advantages they may bring.

sessions.title: Workshop : Exploiting a product's wormholes
sessions.description:
There are many reasons why a product can become a real success or failure. Get ready and embark with us on a journey through product wormholes, right up to the encounter points with your product’s archenemies: inutility, cancellation, litigation, bankruptcy. We'll take a look on how apparently disconnected events in your product lifecycle tie in together and influence the end result. The workshop explores how past decisions, actions and events influence the product’s present value. Join us on holodeck to learn about some major factors that influence the product fabric, and identify the counter maneuvers that help you keep the product on course. 

Registrations open!
https://goo.gl/forms/RdJbrbhfwDRxYtd52

sessions.title: DevTools Deep Dive
sessions.description: No, Firefox DevTools does not mean Firebug. Mozilla created the Firefox Developer Edition and we’ll talk about all the goodness that we baked into it. We’ll talk about the developer tools currently there and how to use them efficiently.

sessions.title: Quality Driven Approach for Evaluating Software Architectures
sessions.description: What makes a technical solution good, or even good enough? There are no good or bad architectures, only architectures that fit the goals more or less, and what are the risks when they don't. I propose to start talking about architectures , and especially their evaluation in terms of quality attributes, the tradeoffs between them and trying to get fit for purpose. Let’s explore together what architectural tradeoffs are, how they relate to quality attributes and how do you reach a fit for purpose state while keeping your customers happy.

sessions.title: SUPPORT TESTING  WITH BRIDGES OVER  THE COMMUNICATION  PATH GAP
sessions.description:
Software testing is knowledge work, and the most important elements we operate every day is information. This element of daily work can take many shapes, including both evident format, such as specifications, implementation details, test details, test results, as well as tacit information and knowledge that is in abundance in today’s cross functional software development teams.

At the same time, the most influential person I know of in the software testing industry, Jerry Weinberg, said in one of his books that testers have a primary mission of delivering information to those who are to make decisions about the tested piece of work. Many times, the decision-making persons are not mentally close to neither how software is developed not how it is tested. These stakeholders can exercise power and influence in the organization, and usually have a more business-oriented mindset. These are the kind of persons testers need to provide information to, as Jerry said.

The difference between testers and business stakeholders in terms of mindset, culture and other aspects of how software is approached potentially create a communication gap between these two sides who should work together.

On the other side, Linda Rising once said that in order to influence one, communication is best to use the language of the one needing influencing.

Operating with information, mastering testing sometimes equals mastering communication, besides the excelling in the testing craft. At times, testers even if good communicators, need to co-exist in organizational environments that have the communication channels & mechanisms shaped by others, such as project managers or other business related roles, and testers need to be able to navigate and thrive in such communication landscapes.

I will show how a communication model can serve both building the message appropriate for business and PM to understand, as well as for explaining better the role and function of the testing activity in the context of the project and share my experience on how testers can advocate for their role or structure communication with stakeholders by using project management body of knowledge elements.

sessions.title: Looking beyond the code
sessions.description: Code is great and building apps is fantastic. What to do to maximize the chances of building successful apps? And why should we care about this.

sessions.title: Brewing Eisbock with Raspberry PI and Windows 10 IoT
sessions.description:
This presentation focuses on real-life IoT system that supports brewing eisbock beer. Sample device is built on Raspberry PI and Windows 10 IoT. It includes also temperature sensors to measure beer and ambient temperature. There is Windows 10 Universal Application that allows to control the process and read metrics from Raspberry PI. Data from Raspberry PI will be later visualized using charts. The presentation goes through all steps of building such solution.
Presentation page: http://gunnarpeipman.com/presentations/brewing-eisbock-with-raspberry-pi-and-windows-10-iot/

sessions.title: UX Design Challenges for Internet of Things
sessions.description:
I will talk about a research I did in order to examine one of the interaction design challenges that come along
with the rapid development of Internet of Things (IoT) field: the fact that once they become connected to internet, we are no longer required to physically interact with the objects around us. The results of the research will reveal that for interacting with objects remotely there is a need for richer interactions, that go beyond the screen and the mobile design patterns, currently imposed to us.

sessions.title: Testing Tours - Exploratory Learning  (part 3)
sessions.description:
To attend you need to RSVP here: http://bit.ly/2ekuXzO

Application tours are very useful in testing, but not many try them out. They definitely should be on your “to learn” list. We propose you a workshop with hands-on touring exercises. You will learn a few possible tours and try them out by yourselves. Then, we’ll do a debrief to discuss what you’ve learned, what the challenges are and how you can apply it in your projects.
You will learn how to do an application tour, which is a handy testing technique. Remember, tours are testing in learning mode, so you will be testing to learn.

sessions.title: Making remote work work
sessions.description:
Tips, tools and stories about my journey from working in an aquarium to leading remote development teams in fluffy slippers.
Don't lie about it, you've thought about this but... decisions, decisions... is remote work for you,  does it even work, how does it work?

sessions.title: Progressive Web Apps - The future
sessions.description: Progressive Web Apps are the new cool kid on the block and I think they're here to make a wave. They take advantage of new technologies to bring the best of mobile sites and native applications to users. They're reliable, fast, engaging and designed to work offline first. In this session we we tackle the basics of PWAs, what sets them apart, why the need and how we could implement something like this ourselves.  So get ready for some interesting talks about the future of the web!

sessions.title: Building Cross Platform Mobile Apps with Xamarin.Forms
sessions.description: An introduction to the Xamarin.Forms platform with examples and use cases, covering  UI layer, binding, navigation and localization to get you started with a template app for Android and iOS.

sessions.title: Workshop (continued) : Exploiting a product's wormholes
sessions.description:
There are many reasons why a product can become a real success or failure. Get ready and embark with us on a journey through product wormholes, right up to the encounter points with your product’s archenemies: inutility, cancellation, litigation, bankruptcy. We'll take a look on how apparently disconnected events in your product lifecycle tie in together and influence the end result. The workshop explores how past decisions, actions and events influence the product’s present value. Join us on holodeck to learn about some major factors that influence the product fabric, and identify the counter maneuvers that help you keep the product on course. 

Registrations open!
https://goo.gl/forms/RdJbrbhfwDRxYtd52

sessions.title: Cybersecurity: How to make money in an ever interconnected world
sessions.description: The presentation will focus on real life examples where we exploit system vulnerabilities to get unauthorised access to systems and data.

sessions.title: Human-Machine Interactions
sessions.description: Artificial Intelligence in action.

sessions.title: Delivering with EmberJS
sessions.description:
I'll try to help you deliver a single page app better and faster.
EmberJS is a modern framework with a mission to make you more productive, built by a community that's pushing the web forward. I'm assuming you haven't delivered an app with it before so I'm starting from scratch. 
We'll use tools specific to EmberJS and we'll talk about components and best practices. It's impossible not to compare EmberJS with other Angular or React, so I'll try to highlight what I think are the benefits that distinguish this framework.

sessions.title: The Comfort Zone Myth
sessions.description: It didn’t take too much time to understand there isn’t a lot of science in what many managers, coaches or leaders preach. At first, I was surprised. Soon, I understood that most of the literature in the personal development field doesn’t serve the readers, but the authors. What does it mean to step out of the comfort zone? Is there any good reason to do so? This is a talk about performance through safety and happiness.

sessions.title: ASP.NET MVC Core- what's new
sessions.description: What's new in MVC and C# 6

sessions.title: Testing mobile in the Cloud
sessions.description: Android has a fragmented ecosystem. There are devices out there with square screens or even no 3G antenna. It’s impossible to test on all of them. But if we write automated tests, then maybe we could run these tests on hundreds of real devices in the cloud. Let’s compare Espresso to Appium and Amazon Device Farm to Firebase Device Lab and see which of these we like more.

sessions.title: AI for fun and profit
sessions.description: A introduction in state of the art AI algorithms and some fun examples in how these new type of algorithm can be used across industry.

sessions.title: Îți asumi riscul să nu riști?
sessions.description: O scurtă istorie a valutelor și o descriere a principiilor care guvernează actualul sistem monetar vor crea contextul necesar pentru prezentarea modului în care funcționează Bitcoin. În continuare va depinde de noi să găsim echilibrul între riscuri și oportunități în deciziile pe care le luăm.

sessions.title: [1]  Indie is Trendy | [2]  Games…. more than just fun?!
sessions.description:
[Part 1: 14:00 - 14:25] 
Independent game development is one of the hottest trends right now within the game industry. In this session, Raluca will talk about latest trends in indie games in terms of market, communities and technology.

[Part 2: 14:25 - 14:50]  
Let’s talk about the “serious" element in games and what it actually means. Oana will be our host.

sessions.title: The CTO Handoff: Best Practices For Handing Off
sessions.description: Best practices for leaving a client, company or product organized and ready for hand off to another CTO for various reasons. Learn tips and best practices, documentation hacks, tech tracking as well as some real-life hard lessons learned. This session is good for developers and non-technical founders.

sessions.title: Workshop: SaaS Execution Map - Using a tool for digital product discovery
sessions.description:
If you're a Business Analyst, Product Owner, Product Manager, Founder, Partner, Consultant .... if you have any stake in building digital products from 0 to 1 then you were most likely asked at some point: What will it take to build this? How much time will you need? What skill set do you need in the team? What do you need to succeed?
Join us and find a way to bring clarity in the initial planning and execution phase of a new product. Even if you are already on your way, we will discover together a natural extension to Business Model Canvas that enables us to stay focused on the prize and avoid the common pitfalls of building digital products.

sessions.title: Decisions. How to manage them
sessions.description:
Management of teams, projects, daily life rely heavily on the process of making decisions. 
How you are taking decisions, how you manage the process together with you team, what can you do to make things faster and more efficient you can learn from two experienced managers and entrepreneurs: Laura Birhala and Gabi Manole

sessions.title: Dear Mobile, I'll use Ionic 2. Sincerely, a web dev...
sessions.description:
Mobile app developing is cool...except if you're a front-end developer. You know we're different, right? We love JS and the freedom in brings, not that Java, Objective-C or C# crap! This might be a downside in being able to build mobile apps, or it may be our biggest asset!

So, dear front-end enthusiast, I invite you to find out more about hybrid app development using the brand new Ionic 2 framework.

sessions.title: Does a software tester need to learn to code?
sessions.description:
What is software testing? 
It is simply understanding the functionality and architecture of a piece of software and test it until fear of not finding any bugs turns to boredom? But what about coding? Is that required for a tester or it is a knowledge exclusively for developers? Does coding help in the software testing? Is automation a fantasy, in a euphoric world?
The difference between software delivering and software developing / testing is a topic which can be discussed until the edge of infinity. The pros and cons of each side will be presented from a QA point of view.

sessions.title: CX and design thinking in organisations
sessions.description: Design doesn't scale like engineering. We'll discuss how to build and sustain UX/CX teams in organisations, with a focus on outsourcing and off-shore projects, and how to nurture and grow a team to meet better business objectives and solve more user problems.

sessions.title: Security architectures for the IoT
sessions.description: IoT applications are taking off with more devices being connected to the Internet every month. As IoT systems grow, so does the concern about their security. An attack on an IoT system that is in use by a population group or community can cause serious social, economic and political disruption. Using the actual example of a smart metering implementation, we will look at how an IoT system can be protected and what technologies and open standards are available to do that.

sessions.title: Machine Learning and Javascript
sessions.description: A quick introduction into Machine Learning. Fast prototyping of ML models with Javascript, most widespread algorithms and a short exposition for some examples/libraries.

sessions.title: Creating a CI/CD pipeline for a Java EE application in the cloud
sessions.description: Developing a web application using Java Enterprise Edition platform is something we have done for decades; deploying it to an application server is also something very common. Why stop here? Let’s employ the cloud and a CI/CD pipeline to automate the whole deployment experience.

sessions.title: Dockerizing an ASP .NET Core app with VSTS, Docker Cloud and Azure
sessions.description:
In this session we will take a look at how to run ASP .NET Core apps inside Docker, then deploy it to a VM in Azure using Docker Cloud.

We will also see how to create a fully automated CI/CD flow using GitHub, Visual Studio Team Services and Docker Hub.

sessions.title: Software Suicide Squad - why (even) the Joker is important
sessions.description: Alternative perspective on villains? Let’s find out!

sessions.title: How to break a heart into 1000 pieces? Emotions as the key of This War of Mine marketing campaign.
sessions.description: It's easy to spend 1 000 000 dollars on a marketing campaign of your game and get some good results out of it. It gets tricky though, when you don't have that kind of money and you still want to succeed. During this talk I will explain, how we created the campaign for This War of Mine. How we used emotions and symbolisms instead of 6 figures budget. And how it worked for us in the end.

sessions.title: Bringing change:  patterns and people
sessions.description:
In the last few years more and more comapnies begin their journey in Changing the way they work, trying to be more productive, more client-orietend, more pro-active, to offer a better environment for their employees. More and more companies start their journey in the Agile Transformation.

Though each company has its own specific challenges and needs, some issues are raised:
  - Can there be some common patterns and actions they need to take in order to  get where they need? 
  - Where do they actually want to get to? 
  - What do they want to transition into?
  - What are the steps they need to have in mind 
  - What kind of people they need to focus on to move move the company forward?
  - How can those steps be implemented?

In this talk, based on my experience, I will focus on the patters for change, the teams a company needs to create and the profile of people that can move these teams and actions that need to be taken to advance in the desired direction.

sessions.title: Actor based concurrency with Elixir
sessions.description:
Because of increased demand for interconnected systems(IOT, SAAS) we need new improved ways of handling reliable (soft)real-time systems. One battle-tested approach is based on the Actor Model pioneered by Erlang and brought to the masses by Elixir.

Topics that will be covered:
– actor model concurrency: why is it needed, advantages & disadvantages
- Elixir agents
– OTP patterns for handling agents: GenServer & Supervisor

sessions.title: What about Azure IoT Hub
sessions.description:
In this session we will take a look on how we can integrate Azure IoT Hub in our solutions. At the begining we will start with a simple scenario that will evolve until we will reach the limits of IoT Hub. 
Yes, Azure IoT Hub is not perfect, this is way we will take a look on what are the limitations and workarounds for it. 
If you are working with devices or you want to find more about IoT Hub, this sessesion will unreveal  the secrests of Azure IoT Hub.

sessions.title: How to convice your stakeholders to invest in test automation
sessions.description:
1. Track
My session sits best on the following areas: software testing, test automation, promoting test automation, test automation metrics.
2. Session Summary
Test automation! Everybody understands it’s importance but nobody is willing to invest!
I had a really hard time when I had to convince everybody from my organization that we have to start doing test automation, that we need resources for it and that we have to involve everybody in the process and not only testers.
But I didn’t give up and I gathered and gathered arguments and metrics till I convinced them.
I would like to share this experience with CodeComp community and help them with some ideas for how to convince their peers and stakeholders to implement test automation.

3. Session Take Away
My audience can learn from this session:
- arguments for promoting test automation at all levels( developers, testers, project managers, product owners, IT managers).
- Metrics or statistics to use in the test automation lifecycle (in order to monitor the efficiency of test automation in your organization and in order to monitor if test automation is really happening in your organization).
4. Intended Audience
General audience (all roles from software development industry).
5. Previous Speaking Engagements
Tabara de Testare Bucuresti.

sessions.title: Branching strategies: Choose wisely to minimize costs
sessions.description:
Is your team choosing the branching strategy from the beginning or is it switching after a while to better accommodate the current project stage? How does this affect you and what are the costs involved? Multiply this by the number of repositories, each playing a definite role in a large-scale project, and you will want to know how to minimize the impact.

The branching model needs to be simple - so that everyone involved can grasp it quickly; flexible - so it can serve the needs of very different roles within the project lifecycle; and adaptable - when you have a particular unforeseen need, it should not be a barrier.

See what others are already using, ask a few questions that might drive an adaptation of your choice, and then choose wisely. Then let your team spend their time on coding rather than painfully switching strategies.

sessions.title: What's in it for me? - why a SCRUM team can benefit from a BA
sessions.description:
Is the BA position suitable in a SCRUM team?
Can a BA bring value in the AGILE world of software development?
Which are the benefits for the team and for each discipline represented in it (Testing, Development, Project Management)?
And how the BA can integrate in the team?
These are some questions I would try to answer using my experience so far and with some live examples.

sessions.title: Building neural networks with nodejs
sessions.description: What are neural networks and how we can build one. Why should we care about non conventional systems, such as artificial intelligence. Simulating a simple nervous system to solve different  scenarios.

sessions.title: How to Handle Every #load Testing Challenge
sessions.description: Being good at a technical level is not enough anymore. Scenario thinking, analysing and being creative are getting known as the main attributes in testing. You need to understand the process, analyse and build a strategy from scratch. Scripting is no longer the problem of doing load testing, but knowing all the factors involved and combining scenarios is. This presentation is about how to handle every load testing challenge with ease using some tips.

sessions.title: Inovare, necesitate versus trend
sessions.description:
Propun dezbaterea unui subiect de interes si anume zona de inovare in contextual unei piete dinamice, dominate de cautarea de lucuri noi intr-un termen foarte scurt
Cateva cuvinte cheie: Inovare, inginerie, digital disruptuion, Agile, cloud computing, fog computing.

sessions.title: [1] Could WebGL shape the future of game development? | [2] Introduction to the 3D Game Art Pipeline.
sessions.description:
[Part 1: 16:00 - 16:30]
The WebGL API enables developers to leverage the graphic hardware acceleration power to create complex 3D games and applications in Javascript. Will the extended support across browsers and the emerging WebGL frameworks change the way games are made? Let's find out together with  Bogdan & Adrian!

[Part 2: 16:30 - 16:55]
Doru will have a talk centered on how production of 3D Art is done for games, from concept to game assets. Some of the topics I’ll be covering are: concepting, block-out, basic modelling, material definition and lighting. The presentation will also touch on the tools and techniques that are used for creating AAA assets for games.

sessions.title: Dealing with Stakeholders - What Matters the Most?
sessions.description: What is the most important thing about dealing with stakeholders ? What tricks do you need to make in order to keep them on your side and how can you please everyone?

sessions.title: Dealing with the unexpected - slicing lemons
sessions.description:
We all know that in life things are not all the time as they should be. As in life, in testing we define goals, we make plans, but most of the times, theory is not like practice, and unplanned/unexpected unknowns appear: new technology, new team members, new challenges, new clients, old habits and mentalities... Well, what to do when life gives you, unexpectedly, lemons? You just need to slice those up and find more tequila! 

The best way to make your actions fit is to analyze what you are dealing with and plan your actions for any uncertainties in the current context, taking into consideration each ingredient from the big picture and act simple and ... improvise! Make grape juice from lemons, sit back and watch as the world wonders how you did it.

I faced different challenges along the testing path, from requirements definition to implementation, context understanding to test planning, tool adoption to test lab construction, test metrics to test measurement, coaching testers to selling testing to clients, project specific assignments to test consultancy. I've experienced and learned, from mine and others mistakes, how to plan the known and unknowns in order to adapt to the needs/scope/changes, using and mapping testing best practices at each level of testing. 
 
I would like to share with you my useful checklist of actionable knowledge in testing, a list of tips and tricks that I've learned during my experience, how I've managed the challenges that I've faced and my practical suggestions when dealing with (un)expected situations, in different contexts. 

Let's make lemonade together ... or find tequila to go with it!

sessions.title: Spice up your apps with Vision and Speech APIs from Microsoft Cognitive Services
sessions.description: We managed to build a smart, contextually aware device that understands user’s needs and delivers valuable information about the world around, takes out the frustration of going to new places or meeting new people and ultimately allows a person with sight loss to be more independent, with greater sense of mobility and empowerment. We used Vision API, OCR API and Text To Speech API from Microsoft Cognitive Services.

sessions.title: Estimations in real life
sessions.description: In over fifteen years I came across many unique situations in which estimations were needed. I will talk about the ones that at the first sight looked to be 'Mission Impossible' and the tips and tricks that turned these situations into great final stories.

sessions.title: The future of JavaScript - Open discussion panel
sessions.description: This will be an open discussion panel where several community leaders and experts will discuss about the future of JavaScript.

sessions.title: Kafka Streams: New kid in stream processing town
sessions.description:
We’d like to share with you our (rather short) experience with Kafka Streams, the new Java library for building distributed stream processing apps using Apache Kafka.
We’ll try to explain the concepts behind it, work through some examples and point out some important features and shortcomings.

sessions.title: Build a SaaS-based infrastructure that fits your platform's needs
sessions.description:
In a world where access to ready-made services is increasing every years, the need to develop and integrate custom software architecture components is getting pushed to edge cases. For a lot of applications being developed you can build an entire stack out of SaaS components and still achieve the performance criteria without the hassle that comes with scaling.
But where and how should you start?

sessions.title: Robust AI for Fast Action Games
sessions.description: This presentation will describe the architecture and techniques we use to deliver challenging AI in our upcoming game Second Hand: Frankie's Revenge. We will discuss multi-agent coordination, dynamic pacing and behavior built to handle fast paced action.

sessions.title: Augmented Reality for Industry 4.0
sessions.description:
Industry 4.0 comes with interconnected machines using IoT, cloud computing and machine learning (beside many other things). We at iQuest are working on an end to end IoT solution architecture which includes gateways for devices, IoT hubs, maintenance case predictions, real time business intelligence and augmented reality support for devices maintenance and predictive maintenance.  Additionally, we are testing Augmented Reality to provide a better experience and support for field engineers doing devices maintenance work.
This session will present high level an example IoT architecture, then will focus on details regarding how to implement holographic and object augmentation experiences in devices maintenance using Microsoft Hololens, Unity, Visual Studio and the PTC Vuforia platform.

sessions.title: Security in Agile Environments
sessions.description:
Agile environments usually break product development work into small increments with continuous deployments to production. The fast pace also affects the security approach by limiting the time the security departments have to test the code and recommend a fix. 
Security needs to hook itself on various iterations in the development lifecycle for them to be effective in creating secure products and decrease business costs for fixing the bugs. My talk is just an example of how can this be achieved, with its challenges and benefits.

sessions.title: The Raffle: Come and Win Your Prizes!

speakers.name: Sorin Peste
speakers.bio:

Silviu’s areas of interest are around how small teams can be most effective in building real software: high-quality, secure systems at the highest limits of robustness, pe
